result.execSummary:
The defendant Zachary A. Anderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Zachary A. Anderson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Zachary A. Anderson was found guilty of Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Pepin County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
1) The defendant will have no further contacts w/law enforcement during term of agrmt. that give rise to probable cause for arrest due to criminal conduct.
2)Defendant shall notify Pepin County District Attorney's Office of any change of residence or employment.
3)One month prior to completion of contract, defendant must contact Pepin County District Attorney's Office for a final interview.
4)Report in person as requested by the Pepin County District Attorney or other supervisor designated by him.
5) The defendant must follow the rules and regulations as set forth by probation, if applicable.
ADDITIONAL CONDITIONS:  See DAGPA

Pay costs according to a schedule set up by Probation & Parole.
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

Provide a DNA sample.
Demonstrate responsibility by diligently seeking full-time employment or education.

timeConds.notes: Serve 45 days in the Pepin County Jail with credit for 45 days served.

Defendant Zachary A. Anderson in court with attorney Angela Jayne Swenson.  Defendant Zachary A. Anderson in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Count 1
Count 1

Defendant Zachary A. Anderson in court with attorney S. Joseph Randtke.  Defendant Zachary A. Anderson in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Counsel confirms receipt of PSI and reviewed with his client.  Note correction to his Dad's name of T.H., not G.K., that is his brother's Dad.  State recommends 3 yrs. probation as recommended in PSI, not asking prison; conditions:  45 days conditional jail with 45 days served; he'll remain on a PO hold until he can get into the Farmen Center.  Atty Randtke agrees with 45 days credit, benefits of ATR, and agrees with recommendation.  Defendant addressed the Court.  Court withholds sentence and places defendant on 3 yrs. probation with condition: sentence to 45 days in the PCJ with credit for 45 days served; order DNA sample; pay costs $516.00 according to schedule set up by P&P; demonstrate responsibility by diligently seeking full-time epmployment or education; advised of appeal rights; felony prohibitions as convicted felon.

Count 1

Defendant Zachary A. Anderson in court with attorney S. Joseph Randtke.  Defendant Zachary A. Anderson in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Agreement reached.  Defendant will plead to count 1 in 15CF50 DPA; count 2 in 16CF11 and count 3 in 16CF07; 2 yrs probation on 2 misdemeanors w/jail; State w/draws motion to revoke bond in 15CF50; all other counts and cases will be dismissed.   Court advises defendant of charge in count 2 of 16CF11, defendant pleads guilty; advised of charge in count 3 of 16CF07, defendant pleads guilty; advised of charge in count 1 of 15CF50, defendant pleads guilty.  Plea colloquy.  Court finds defendant's waiver of his constitutional rights and pleas done K&V, accepts plea in 16CF11 & 16CF07 and finds defendant guilty; court defers acceptance of plea in 15CF50 and approves DPA; court withholds sentence & places defendant on 2 yrs. probation on 2 misdemeanors with conditions.  Advised of appeal rights.
Atty S. Joseph Randtke appt'd.

Defendant Zachary A. Anderson in court. Attorney Melissa M. Petersen appeared by phone means for Defendant Zachary A. Anderson.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Peterson represents defendant on old case, has a conflict on newly filed case.  State has a pending motion to revoke bond in 15CF50.  Atty Peterson agrees to have counsel appointed on both cases.  All matters continued until new attorney assigned.  Court shows Ms. Peterson as w/drawn as counsel.  Defendant informs he qualifies for SPD, waives time limits for PH in 16CF07.  Status conference scheduled for March 1, 2016 at 02:30 pm.  Motion hearing scheduled for March 1, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Defendant Zachary A. Anderson in court, in custody.  Jon D. Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court confirms defendant received copy of criminal complaint, advises of charges/max. penalties and rights and right to preliminary hearing within 10 days if in custody, 20 days if not.  State requests $1000 Sign. Bond with conditions:  no possession or consumption of alcohol; no possession of prescription drugs w/o valid prescription; follow rules of foster home.  Court sets $500 Sign. Bond with conditions:  no violation of law; no controlled substance w/o a prescription; no drinking; follow reasonable rules of foster home and be in foster home every night unless have foster homes permission.  Court notes waiver of time limits for PH.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
